books.title: The Playboy of the Western World
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A young man in the west coast of Ireland is lionized after he claims to have killed his father.

books.title: Five Weeks in a Balloon
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: Three men attempt to cross Africa by balloon.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: Sylvie and Bruno
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: Two siblings alternate between fantasy and the real world after their father is the victim of a political conspiracy.

books.title: The Innocence of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Amateur detective and Catholic priest Father Brown solves mysteries in this first collection of Father Brown short stories.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: That Affair Next Door
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: Mysterious midnight visitors to a New York mansion are observed by a spinster living next door.

books.title: The Conscience of a Conservative
books.author: Barry Goldwater
books.summary: A U.S. Senator and future presidential nominee outlines key principles of the 20th century American conservative movement.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A collection of Thomas Paine’s essays on republicanism, the problems of monarchy, and human rights.

books.title: Metamorphoses
books.author: Ovid
books.summary: A collection of Greek and Roman myths that involve various forms of transformation.

books.title: Northanger Abbey
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A young girl with an overactive imagination comes of age.

books.title: The World Set Free
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Facing the devastation of a nuclear world war, humanity unites under a world government.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: Six classic science fiction short stories by Stanley Weinbaum.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.
